You can very easily deny that he's doing any communication. Proper communication usually requires not completely ignoring what people say to you and saying "My way or the highway."

Anybody who's not blinded by hatred for what's been done to Cass over the last three months can see that he's [not completely ignoring](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/8Vz3Nbpo-riotstashu-i-think-i-know-how-casss-passive-can-work-everyone-else-hear-me-out?comment=0002) everything.

I know you're going to say, "but that thread isn't against the current passive!" I know, it was just the easiest to find since it's at the top of hot sorting right now. I can find other examples if you want, but I don't *really* feel like debating this right now. Even if he weren't listening, the point remains that he's been reading a lot and posting a LOT more than others have in the past, and making him feel like shit for it:

1. Isn't a good way to encourage him or other devs who might not have skin so thick to continue in the future.
or
2. Get him to listen to your ideas.
That post really highlights what Chumbler is talking about. It's a walk-around way of saying "Thanks for your input but I already know what I want to do".

There's a difference between "We're taking your request into consideration" and "Yeah we'll just bend right over and do exactly what you want".

To be frank, the Cassiopeia rework's had a faster time for adjustments in patch cycles and *shitloads* more Rioter interaction than pretty much any rework before, but because there's a vocal segment who are convinced that the only thing that qualifies 'listening to them' is 'revert the passive' they're pretending somehow they've been completely ignored.

Like honestly, from the outside looking in - from someone who's been part of a lot of discussions on champ rebuilds - the "but there's no communication on Cassiopeia" is bullshit.

Being left for almost a month after release with absolutely no comment in any form is a pretty good basis for complaining on lack of communication. Yes, he's started speaking now. It doesn't erase the past.

So many people have just been worn down to "revert the passive" because of how stubbornly attached to it the "designer" is, not because he didn't immediately change it to fit their whims, but because **every single proposed change to it has been the exact opposite of what's needed for a cohesive kit**.

> [{quoted}](name=Serpents Embrace,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7E0Wigsy,comment-id=000600020001000000010000,timestamp=2014-11-29T05:56:41.686+0000)
>
> Being left for almost a month after release with absolutely no comment in any form is a pretty good basis for complaining on lack of communication. Yes, he's started speaking now. It doesn't erase the past.

Launching something and then waiting a month is a really, really good idea.  Riot has changed launched content too early too often.  Remember when they buffed Zed after launch?  Or Gnar?  Yeah, turns out people just needed more time to learn how to use the new thing.  Now, that wasn't the story with Cass, but I still think it was useful to give us a while to play the thing so we had high quality feedback.

Also, I don't think any reworker has interacted more with the community than Stashu.  I'm not going to say it was a smooth process, or that the resulting design is perfect, but we're not where we are for lack of red text.
 
> So many people have just been worn down to "revert the passive" because of how stubbornly attached to it the "designer" is, not because he didn't immediately change it to fit their whims, but because **every single proposed change to it has been the exact opposite of what's needed for a cohesive kit**.

Reverting Cass passive is an obviously terrible idea.  Deadly Cadence solves none of the problems New Cass has and creates a big new scaling problem.

Moving to a new Cass passive with better poisony feel is possible, but I haven't seen a proposal that really feels right yet.  The current one does a job mechanically, and does it pretty well; we can't exchange it for a passive that feels great but plays badly.
